petri.api

Class Button

  • java.lang.Object
    • petri.api.Button

  • public class Button
extends java.lang.Object
    Graphic representing a clickable area for game control.
    Author:
    Cody Swendrowski

        y - y_pos to draw at

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draws the Button using the current color scheme.
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics to draw with

      • isClicked

        public boolean isClicked()
        Returns true if Button was clicked; else, returns false. If it is true, it sets it to false immediately. One-use method.
        Returns:
        clicked

      • checkOver

        public boolean checkOver(int x,
                int y)
        Checks to see if mouse is hovering over Button.
        Parameters:
        x - X position of mouse
        y - Y position of mouse
        Returns:
        True if mouse is over Button

      • checkClick

              int my)
        Checks mouseclick against Button location.
        Parameters:
        mx - Mouseclick x_pos
        my - Mouseclick y_pos

      • isOneClicked

        public static boolean isOneClicked(java.util.List<Button> buts)
        A helper method that checks to see if a Button is clicked, given a list of Buttons
        Parameters:
        buts - List to check
        Returns:
        True if at least one Button is clicked

        public void setColorScheme(java.awt.Color newC1,
                  java.awt.Color newC2,
                  java.awt.Color newFont)
        Sets the color scheme used to draw the Button.
        Parameters:
        newC1 - Color to use as outline around Button
        newC2 - Color to fill Button with
        newFont - Color to draw text with
